channel.title: Daw-Chih's tech articles
channel.description: Daw-Chih is a software engineer, UX advocate, and creator who is dedicated to Web engineering. His background in Human Centered Computing has led him to work with startups and public companies across North America, Asia, and Europe. He is passionate about meeting business trajectory with user journey and utilizing engineering architecture and performance monitoring to provide optimal user experience.

item.title: Testing With Fixtures in Rust
item.description: No more awkward test cases. Here's one fixture-based testing framework that cleaned up my Rust unit tests.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Share Rust Types With TypeScript for WebAssembly in 30 Seconds
item.description: Discover the most seamless developer experience with Rust and WebAssembly. This is the fastest way to auto-generate TypeScript definitions from your Rust code.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: The Last Dockerfile You Need for NestJS
item.description: The ultimate NestJS Dockfile for optimized production image and local development.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Optimize Google Cloud BigQuery and Control Cost
item.description: I unknowingly blew $3,000 in 6 hours on one query in Google Cloud BigQuery. Here's why and 3 easy steps to optimize the cost.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: How to Run A Tech Community in Your Company: An Ex-Principal Engineerâ€™s Guide
item.description: 5 easy steps to create a sustainable tech community in your company that everyone loves.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: WASM Semantic Search in Rust
item.description: Introducing Voy, a portable WebAssembly semantic search engine with vector similarity search in Rust.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Lean Docker Images for Next.JS
item.description: Using multi-stage builds to optimize production Docker image for faster deployment.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Is Qwik Faster than React Server Component?
item.description: A benchmark comparison and analysis between Qwik and Next.js 13.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Tired of Slow Code Reviews? Read this
item.description: An ex-tech lead's guide to create a healthy code review culture that helps you ship your code faster.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Deploying Like Vercel and Netlify with Cloud Run: Live, Preview, and Modern Workflow
item.description: The modern workflow that unlocks your team's potential to ship faster.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Easiest Way to Understand Rust Modules Across Multiple Files
item.description: With a real-world example
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Ex-Principal Engineer's Guide to Design Thinking and Continuous Delivery
item.description: How do the big tech companies and unicorn startups succeed in agile product development while maintaining code quality.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Building A Custom Google Maps Marker React Component Like Airbnb in Next.js
item.description: We will be building a proof of concept to create customer Google Maps markers using any React component in a Next.js project.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Event Bus for React
item.description: Event Bus is an interesting design pattern to build a lightweight event system. We will discover its use cases in React and build a type-safe Event Bus from scratch with TypeScript.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: React Explained for Product Managers
item.description: Everything you need to know about the component-oriented library.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Stress Testing Concurrent Features in React 18: A Case Study of startTransition & 3D Rendering
item.description: React 18 released the highly anticipated concurrent features. In this article, we are diving into a 3D visualization and discuss how to optimize its performance step by step with React 18's concurrent rendering.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: I Built A Snappy Static Full-text Search with WebAssembly, Rust, Next.js, and Xor Filters
item.description: After migrating to Contentlayer, I started exploring how to use the content data to roll out a search feature for my portfolio. Inspired by some of the amazing open-source projects, I built my own full-text search engine in Rust and WebAssembly. It is fast, lightweight, and tons of fun to build!
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: How to Plan A Project as A Principal Software Engineer: A Human-centered Approach
item.description: Operating as a principal software engineer is all about bringing engineering, business, and people close together. There are many things to consider in terms of time budget, resources, and even your own involvement when it comes to planning. I want to share with you how I think about the important questions to ask in the planning phase of the project.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Building Better Next.js Static Sites with MDX and Contentlayer
item.description: Recently I have been researching on reducing the effort to create a new article on my static website. I analyzed more and found out the friction was in my MDX usage with Next.js. After shifting to Contentlayer, publishing content becomes so effortless. I will show you how.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: From Frontend Developer to Principal Software Engineer
item.description: I recently joined a European public company as a Lead Software Engineer. The role has a combined responsibility of Principal Software Engineer and Senior Engineering Manager. It is challenging but I was prepared. I want to share with you 50+ books and resources that help me in my journey.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Binary Tree Insertion in Rust
item.description: I was struggling with Rust's ownership when implementing a Binary Tree so I re-read about it. After taking my time understanding it and refactoring, I finally made a breakthroughðŸ˜Ž I'm very excited to share with you the awesome features in Rust I came across. You'll see interesting concepts like smart pointers and ownership.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Indexing Strings in Rust and TypeScript: A Case Study of String
item.description: Text is essential in programming languages. String is the Rust's and JavaScript's definition to process text in written languages around the world. Through the simple concept of string indexing, we'll discuss how Rust and JavaScript process strings and how they handle the nuances in strings such as grapheme, or even emojis.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Writing Your Own TypeScript CLI
item.description: Writing CLIs feels like a super powerðŸ’¯ You can write one too! I'll show you how to develop a CLI with TypeScript step by step and demonstrate how you can apply your CLI in CD/CI pipelines. We're going to uncover the power of Google Lighthouse and many more amazing npm packages!
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Rethinking the Next-gen Analytics Web App at trivago
item.description: How trivago Frontend Engineering revamped the company's Business Intelligence web application. After almost a decade, we decided to rebuild our in-house Business Intelligence web application to better support the organization. We successfully completed the project because we fundamentally challenged and re-thought all aspects of the project.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Using WebP for Better User Experience
item.description: WebP is a modern image format that provides outstanding image quality with smaller image size. I'll show you how much you can benefit from it and how to setup your project for optimal developer experience.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: 3 Principles to Triumph Your Software Project
item.description: Practical experience that shapes billion dollar enterprise. I have been very fortunate to take a part in important topics at trivago. We have brought groundbreaking changes in accommodation search. It was clear that our data-informed approach is the foundation to innovation. I want to share with you our learnings.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Writing Better Marble Tests for Redux Observable and TypeScript
item.description: Marble testing is a brilliant way to test observables. It focuses on the behaviors of observables over time. The combination of test assertion and marble diagram let us visualize the progression of emitted values over time.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: JavaScript Workshop with Kyle Simpson
item.description: A recap of the 5-day JavaScript journey. It has been a couple of months since Kyle, author of the â€œYou Donâ€™t Know JSâ€ series, visited our trivago headquarters and gave us a wonderful JavaScript workshop. It was such an enjoyable week, being able to meet Kyle in person and walk through his thinking behind the materials.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou

item.title: Intuitive Transducer in JavaScript
item.description: What is transducing? Simply put, itâ€™s a data transformation process without creating intermediate products. Itâ€™s like a pipeline. Itâ€™s your data on one end, and the pipeline transforms the data and produce your output on the other end.
item.dc:creator: Daw-Chih Liou
